SHS 50.title: Introduction to Communication Disorders
SHS 50.description: Description and illustration of speech, language, and hearing of children and adults with a variety of communication disorders including phonology, stuttering, voice, aphasia, language, and hearing disorders. Includes consideration of precipitating and maintaining factors.

SHS 120.title: Phonemics in Communication Disorders
SHS 120.prereq_description: Speech and Hearing Sciences 50 and Linguistics 20A.
SHS 120.description: Identification of the phonemes of American English and their symbolic representation, including modifying symbols for deviant phonology. Acoustic, physiological, and perceptual parameters of speech sound formation.

SHS 121.title: Physics of Speech and Hearing
SHS 121.description: Introduction to the physics of sound as applicable to speech and hearing sciences; classification of different sounds; properties of sound; acoustics of tubes and its relationship to human speech sounds; psychophysics of hearing: pitch, intensity, loudness and their measurement.

SHS 122.title: Anatomy, Physiology, and Neurology of the Speech Mechanism
SHS 122.description: Anatomical, physiological, and neurological bases for an understanding of speech communication.

SHS 128.title: Aural Anatomy and Pathology
SHS 128.description: Anatomy and physiology of the normal human auditory system; causes and types of hearing impairment; otological considerations medical and surgicalimplications.

SHS 131.title: Assessment and Rehabilitation for Hearing-Impaired Adults
SHS 131.description: Introduction to psychoacoustic principles as applied to audiometric diagnostics and aural rehabilitation with adults.

SHS 155.title: Assessment and Treatment of Child Phonologic Disorders
SHS 155.prereq_description: Speech and Hearing Sciences 50, 120, 166, and Linguistics 137.
SHS 155.description: A study of principle and methods for assessing children's speech productionto determine existence of phonologic disorders and a review of varieties oftreatment methods for such disorders.

SHS 166.title: Principles of Behavior Modification
SHS 166.description: Basic principles of operant conditioning and their use in classroom, family, and clinical environments with special reference to speech-language pathology.

SHS 167.title: Introduction to Stuttering
SHS 167.description: Review and analysis of the features and characteristics of stuttering, the areas and causes of stuttering, conditions that modify stuttering, and current therapies for stuttering.

SHS 182.title: Undergraduate Thesis
SHS 182.description: Independent work with faculty sponsor culminating in senior thesis.

SHS 194.title: Group Studies for Advanced Students
SHS 194.prereq_description: Upper-division standing and consent of instructor.
SHS 194.comments: May be repeated for a maximum of six units.
SHS 194.description: Selected topics in accordance with instructor's area of specialization.

SHS 197.title: Instructional Laboratory
SHS 197.comments: Students must have a 3.0 overall grade-point-average.
SHS 197.description: Tutoring experience for advanced undergraduate students in preparation for graduate education.

SHS 199.title: Independent Studies
SHS 199.comments: Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA for the preceding three quarters and are limited to 5 units per quarter and 30 units total in all 98/99/198/199/199AA-ZZ courses combined.

SHS 594.title: Special Topics
SHS 594.comments: May be repeated with a different topic for a maximum of nine units.
SHS 594.description: Selected topics in accordance with instructors' specializations.
